sentence.Network_en: A surveyor said that the problems were caused by subsidence and the house needed to be underpinned.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名勘测员说是地面下陷导致了这些问题出现，房子需要加固地基。

sentence.Network_en: In more than 30 years of surveying he has never yet known a building to collapse because of subsidence.
sentence.Network_cn: 他做房屋评估工作都30多年了，还从未听说过哪一座房子由于地基下陷而倒塌的。

sentence.Network_en: Now every sound ceased suddenly with the subsidence of Mr. Walter's voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 随着华尔特先生的声音平息下来的时候,一切声音都突然停止了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin subsidentia 'sediment', from the verb subsidere (see subside)

entry.def: When there is subsidence in a place, the ground there sinks to a lower level.

example.ex: A surveyor said that the problems were caused by subsidence and the house needed to be underpinned.
example.tran: 一名勘测员说是地面下陷导致了这些问题出现，房子需要加固地基。

means.word_mean: 1. an abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease);
2. a gradual sinking to a lower level
3. the sudden collapse of something into a hollow beneath it

auth_sentence.content: Coal seams worked near the surface cause the severest subsidence.
auth_sentence.res_content: Coal seams worked near the surface cause the severest subsidence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Coal seams worked near the surface cause the severest subsidence.

auth_sentence.content: Subsidence happens because removing fluids from interstices allows compaction thus settling.
auth_sentence.res_content: Subsidence happens because removing fluids from interstices allows compaction thus settling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Subsidence happens because removing fluids from interstices allows compaction thus settling.

auth_sentence.content: People living above tunnels will receive a life-time guarantee against subsidence.
auth_sentence.res_content: People living above tunnels will receive a life-time guarantee against subsidence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People living above tunnels will receive a life-time guarantee against subsidence.
